explains: n. 前哨；警戒部队；边区村落

sentences.en: It towered above the older buildings like a citadel, which indeed it was, the outpost of a new age, perhaps a new civilization, perhaps a new barbarism.
sentences.cn: 它屹立在古老的建筑之上，像一座城堡，也的确是一个新时代的前哨，这种前哨可能意味着一种新文明，也可能是一种新野蛮。

sentences.en: This rural outpost, 400 miles northeast of Helena, has one stoplight.
sentences.cn: 这个在赫勒拿东北400英里处的农村居民点有一个交通信号灯。

sentences.en: Ice-class tugboat "Nevskaya Zastava" ("Neva Outpost") was designed and constructed in St. Petersburg.
sentences.cn: 冰区航行拖船“涅瓦河前哨”是在圣彼得堡设计和建造的。
